secText:
Essential Question:
How can we calculate rotational motion?

Enduring Understandings:
1. [OBJ:expsec_i957:Angular position] is calculated by measuring the arc length divided by the radius. It is measured in radians. Counterclockwise rotation is positive, while clockwise rotation is negative.
2. [OBJ:expsec_i958:Angular displacement] is the change in angular position. It is calculated by subtracting the initial angular position from the final angular position. It is measured in radians.
3. [OBJ:expsec_i959:Angular velocity] is the angular displacement per elapsed time. It is measured in radians per second.
4. The [OBJ:expsec_i960:angular acceleration] is the change in angular velocity per the elapsed time. It is measured in radians per second squared.
